Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Transversus Thoracic Muscle Plane Block in Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at a single institution.

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults aged 18-50 years, ASA physical status II-III, undergoing elective cardiac surgery with median sternotomy.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received a pre-induction TTPB with 30 mL of 0.2% ropivacaine, while the control group did not.

Objective.evidence: The study aimed to evaluate the effect of a pre-induction transversus thoracic muscle plane block (TTPB) on intraoperative haemodynamic response and perioperative fentanyl requirement in adult cardiac surgery patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative haemodynamic response, measured by changes in MAP and HR.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifteen patients were randomised, with 7 receiving TTPB and 8 in the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean intraoperative fentanyl consumption was lower in the TTPB group (7.93 ± 1.16 µg kg−1).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the block were reported.
